content:
A. Jerusalem B. Bethphage C. Nazareth D. 
Bethany 
 
36. At the trials of Jesus, Pilate was perplexed because 
A. the Jews had no genuine case against Him 
B. Jesus gave no answer to the charges 
C. the Jews asked for the release of 
Barabbas, a notorious criminal 
D. he knew that Jesus had performed many 
miracles among the Jews., 
 
37. Why did the accusers of Jesus stay behind while He 
was led to the Praetorium? 
A. It was forbidden to follow the accused 
B. They were prevented from entering 
C. It was a Sabbath day 
D. They did not want to be defiled. 
 
38. Who was forced to carry the cross behind Jesus? 
A. Peter B. Joseph of Arimathea 
C. Andrew D. Simon of Cyrene, 
 
39. “Truly I say to you, today you will be with me in Paradise”. 
A. Zacchaeus  B.    the repentant robber 
C. the centurion D. Cleopas. 
 
40. According to Luke, the people who first got to Jesus’ 
tomb were 
A. Mary the mother of Jesus, Peter and John 
B. Peter and Joanna 
C. Mary Magdalene and the other women 
D. Peter and John. 
41. Jesus Christ, the Good Shepherd was loved by the 
Father because He 
A. understood the needs of the sheep 
B. loved the sheep 
C. tended the sheep 
D. laid down His life for the sheep. 
 
42. Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life: he 
who believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, 
and whoever lives and believes in me shall never die…” 
On what occasion was this statement made? 
A. On the day of Jesus resurrection 
B. When Jesus demonstrated the fact of His 
resurrection to Thomas 
C. On the day Jesus restored Lazarus back 
to life 
D. When Jairus daughter was raised from the 
dead. 
43. According to Paul, if we give away all that we and we 
deliver our bodies to be burnt, but have not love we 
A. are like a noisy gong 
B. are like a clanging cymbal 
C. gain only the world 
D. gain nothing 
 
44. “Now the company of those who believed were of one 
hart and soul…” 
This reveals that the early Christians 
A. had everything in common 
B. prayed together every hour 
C. celebrated the Holy Communion daily 
D. were always filled with the Holy Spirit. 
 
45. The suggestion to choose the seven deacons was made 
by  
A. Paul   B.   Peter C. the twelve D. the church 
 
46. “And in the last days it shall be, God declares, that I 
will pour out my Spirit upon all flesh, and your sons 
and your daughters shall prophesy, and you’re your 
men shall see visions…”This prophecy was fulfilled 
A. during the baptism of Jesus 
B. at Pentecost 
C. during the Transfiguration 
D. at His crucifixion. 
 
47. But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit has 
come upon you, and you shall be my witnesses in 
Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria and to the end 
of the earth. 
This statement commissions the apostles to 
A. establish the church in Jewish cities 
B. preach only to the Jews 
C. carry the gospel to all continents 
D. preach to the Gentiles in and outside Palestine 
 
48. Who was sent by God to restore Saul’s sight after his 
encounter with Jesus on the road to Damasus? 
A. Simon B. Stephen C. Aeneas D. Ananias. 
 
49. “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to 
which I have called them 
This statement was made by the 
A. Holy Spirit B. Church C. elders D. apostles. 
 
50. Following his encounter with the apostles, the 80 ruler 
of Cyprus 
A. dismissed them 
B. became blind for resisting the gospel 
C. requested that they choose another time to 
preach the gospel 
D. believed the gospel. 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1994  
 
 
1. When Elijah escaped to the brook Cherith, he was fed 
by  
A. angels   B.    doves C. ravens D. sparrows, 
 
2. The contest on Mount Caronel was to prove that 
A. Baal was the god of Israel 
B. Baal controlled nature 
C. God was supreme to other gods  
D. Israel had faith in God 
3. Naboth did not agree to release his vineyard to Ahab 
because  
A. the amount offered for it was too small 
B. it was his major source of income 
C. it was his only vineyard 
D. it was the inheritance  of his fathers. 
 
4. What did Gehazi deceitful receive from Naaman? 
A. two talents of silver and two  festal garments 
B. two talents of silver and two shekels of gold
